Question
========

The scores on a Citoto test of arithmetic for children in the last group of elementary school are normally distributed and have a national mean of 20 and a standard deviation of 5. What is the probability that in a random sample of 9 children a mean score between 22 and 24 (in the subinterval 22 to 24) be found?

Answerlist
----------

* 0.48.
* 0.50.
* 0.98.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.48.: Correct .
* 0.50.: Incorrect
* 0.98.: Incorrect
